content.description: After eyeing this line for almost a year, it's finally done! It has good protection with your typical section of Monument mud stone. Work your way up on a combination of finger, hand, and fist jams.  We aided the section of poor rock and later TR'd it at 5.11(one move). The rest of the route climbs around 5.10 and would be a 4 star route without the bad section.
content.location:
This is just right of

Genesha

above the Devil's Gate Tower. Hike off climber's left.

content.description: Hands, smears, and body scumming will come into play as you climb up this. The protection is there though the rock is flaky in parts. It is also easy to set up a toprope if you don't want to lead this.
content.protection: All cams from 0.5 to 3, and a double set would be extra nice.
content.location:
Start on the same shelf as

Vyasa

. You can rappel in from the rim of the canyon or climb an easy route below the shelf to gain access. This is a pretty good route. It is worth doing along with the others that are close by.

content.description: I have not climbed this one, but there is a register on the top of "Devil's Gate Tower" that documents this ascent. The route climbs a broken but solid looking, vertical vein that trends right into a great looking dihedral to top out. This is the first ascent of this tower as well.
content.location:
This route is just right of

Buddah's Belly

and tops out the Devil's Gate Tower. Hike off climber's left.

content.description: What a cool chimney! Press, push, jam, and scum your way up this. If you only climb "the best", you'll hate this route...if you're into adventure, questionable placements, and unique climbing, this route is for you!
content.location:
This is on Devil's Gate Tower at the mouth of Devil's Canyon. Hike to Phantom Spire Wall, climb

Kurukshetra

, then walk left on the massive ledge to Devil's Gate Tower. This route follows the left weakness in the large chimney. It is also just right of

Panduva

.

content.description: There is good gear the whole way even though there is some loose/bad rock. The crux is getting into the final crack.
content.location: This is on the wall as pictured on the left side of Devil's Canyon as you are hiking in.

content.description: Use hand, first, and OW moves.  It has 3 distinct cruxes and very interesting movement.
content.protection: 2x .75 to #2 Then 4X #4 to #6 to see this up. 80m rope is needed
content.location: This is the massive OW visible as soon as The Devils Gate tower comes into view. It can be hiked off to the climbers left with a bit of 5th Class scrambling.  One can also lower at the top of P1.

content.description:
The first pitch is the best climbing and the crux - 5.10 OW to a good ledge and belay. P2 goes up through the well-protected corner/roof, 5.10- .Continue up a loose and blocky chimney to a really cool belay deeper in the chimney. P3 climbs a short wall (5.8) then continues into the saddle.

Hike off climber's left.
content.protection: P1: 2 #5s and 3 #6s. P2/3: #0.3, 2 x 0.75, 1, 2 , 2 × #3, 4, and 5 (save 2 x #3s for the belay).
content.location: Hike D2 approximately 1.8 miles until you see a large boulder on the left. Turn here, and hike up to the base of the buttress/tower.
